commit_message:
Documentation for 'snmp' hardware type

Documentation for 'snmp' hardware type and a minor string fix for
node's driver_info field ``snmp_security``.

Change-Id: I31c1429254172d4b5efb85a063c9cf7564279fca
Closes-Bug: #1704977
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/68/493468/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Add ``snmp`` to the list of ``enabled_hardware_types`` in ``ironic.conf``: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] enabled_hardware_types = snmp #. To enable SNMP classic driver, add ``pxe_snmp`` to the list of ``enabled_drivers`` in ``ironic.conf``: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] enabled_drivers = pxe_snmp #. Restart the Ironic conductor service.Nodes configured to use the SNMP driver should have the ``driver`` field set to ``snmp`` (hardware type) or to the classic driver ``pxe_snmp``. The following configuration values has to be added to the node's ``driver_info`` field:- ``snmp_version``: (optional) SNMP protocol versionThe following command can be used to enroll a node with the ``snmp`` driver: .. code-block:: bash openstack baremetal node create --driver snmp \ --driver-info snmp_driver=<pdu_manufacturer> \ --driver-info snmp_address=<ip_address> \ --driver-info snmp_outlet=<outlet_index> \ --driver-info snmp_community=<community_string>
deleted_lines: - Add ``pxe_snmp`` to the list of ``enabled_drivers`` in ``/etc/ironic/ironic.conf`` - Ironic Conductor must be restarted for the new driver to be loaded.Nodes are configured for SNMP control by setting the Ironic node object's ``driver`` property to be ``pxe_snmp``. Further configuration values are added to ``driver_info``:- ``snmp_protocol``: (optional) SNMP protocol version

commit_message:
doc: point to the main git repository and update links

- no need to refer to github; point to the main repositories
  on git.openstack.org and remove the requirement for a github
  account in order to contribute;
- update few links which have been moved around and fix at least
  the associated message of a link;
- link to the website for HTTPie.

Change-Id: Ib310815d346e2364de1a2282f3f1e2d94590c3d2
(cherry picked from commit 5662d84690f36e2c4162de101a74150562b3ca40)

subject: Delete controller for standalone OVS bridges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-21 16:30:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_objects.py', 'os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/tests/test_impl_eni.py', 'os_net_config/objects.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config/commit/f8d76d2cdebfa0d06233a59a8f6539207c5b5a4e', 'message': "Delete controller for standalone OVS bridges

The patch adds an OVS extra parameter to delete controller for bridges
configured with standalone fail mode. By default, bridges are created
without having an openflow controllers. If node is restarted, the bridge
is set to standalone mode but if a service managing the bridge sets a
controller, it will remain in the ovsdb.

As ovs-vswitchd sets the bridge behavior to normal MAC learning switch
only if bridge in standalone mode can't communicate with its controller,
leaving controller defined can cause node outage when bridge is used as
management network. In such case controller service, like
neutron-openvswitch-agent, would need to communicate over management
network but given that bridge is in standalone mode but communicates
with controller, management network won't be reachable. This creates a
chicken-egg problem.

By removing controller by default, ovs-vswitchd implements a normal
action rule to the standalone bridge and service can use the bridge as
management network and eventually set the brdige to secure and set the
flows manually.

See opened Bugzilla for more information:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1473763

Change-Id: Iad48312667834ea8f5c7145595ae89cb5159b36d
"}]
commit_message:
Delete controller for standalone OVS bridges

The patch adds an OVS extra parameter to delete controller for bridges
configured with standalone fail mode. By default, bridges are created
without having an openflow controllers. If node is restarted, the bridge
is set to standalone mode but if a service managing the bridge sets a
controller, it will remain in the ovsdb.

As ovs-vswitchd sets the bridge behavior to normal MAC learning switch
only if bridge in standalone mode can't communicate with its controller,
leaving controller defined can cause node outage when bridge is used as
management network. In such case controller service, like
neutron-openvswitch-agent, would need to communicate over management
network but given that bridge is in standalone mode but communicates
with controller, management network won't be reachable. This creates a
chicken-egg problem.

By removing controller by default, ovs-vswitchd implements a normal
action rule to the standalone bridge and service can use the bridge as
management network and eventually set the brdige to secure and set the
flows manually.

See opened Bugzilla for more information:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1473763

Change-Id: Iad48312667834ea8f5c7145595ae89cb5159b36d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/19/495919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: DEFAULT_OVS_BRIDGE_FAIL_MODE = 'standalone' ovs_extra.append('set bridge {name} fail_mode=%s' % fail_mode) ovs_extra.append('set bridge {name} fail_mode=%s' % fail_mode)

commit_message:
Add doc8 rule and check doc/source files

doc8 is a linter for documents and used in openstack-manuals.
It is better to enforce document linters for simple checking.
This change is to add doc8 in tox file and fix line too long
in some files.

The current rules are as bellow:
- invalid rst format - D000
- lines should not be longer than 79 characters - D001
  - RST exception: line with no whitespace except in the beginning
  - RST exception: lines with http or https urls
  - RST exception: literal blocks
  - RST exception: rst target directives
- no trailing whitespace - D002
- no tabulation for indentation - D003
- no carriage returns (use unix newlines) - D004
- no newline at end of file - D005

Change-Id: I5b409fbfd95e05921310c6ecf4afea0220fb0bf0

commit_message:
Fix octavia l7rules

The l7rules patch had a bad rebase and ended up getting merged in a broken
state as indicated by the functional test gate failure (non-voting).

This patch fixes this issues from the bad rebase and allows the tests to pass.

Change-Id: I4b2270f32c467e18d6ec203f20692685453687cd

commit_message:
Support container_override_args

For a containerized_overcloud scenario, the composable scenario arguments defined in
'scenario_args' are included in the overcloud deploy command before the 'container_args'.
If the composable scenario template wants to override some of the parameters like changing
the neutron plugin etc it is not possible. So this patch supports a new argument
'container_override_args' which is included after the 'container_args'.

This is required for OVN container scenario, where in we want to override
'OS::TripleO::Docker::NeutronMl2PluginBase' to 'puppet/services/neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml'.

Partial-bug: #1699085
Change-Id: If5a9f2e895a91f57751637b45abf1c60188c0872

commit_message:
Revert "Reduce container counts for cinder, ironic and trove"

A fully hyper-converged deployment is fine, but this has not
been done with an agreed spec, nor has it been completed.

This patch is being reverted with the agreement that there
will be a spec and we can tackle this properly in Queens.

This reverts commit b769a6e0c128b96b23dd696a305145f2077c3151.

Change-Id: Ia7ac1084db7610800dca7a860fddc2ad825fa101
(cherry picked from commit 4cba47c1d3a186d189c75e903cbb8be39602fa0f)

commit_message:
Use keystone sessions for swift's connection manager

Sessions are recommended instead of having to manage tokens manually,
and swiftclient supports this. So this switched the connection manager
code to pass those instead.

Also, since keystoneauth's sessions handle the re-authentication, that
bit was removed.

Change-Id: I5d4699520b89b7a73a6870346849ea9c0072bbbf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/02/445802/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.exception(reason) def get_store_connection(self, storage_url, auth_token=None, session=None): if session: return swiftclient.Connection( preauthurl=storage_url, insecure=self.insecure, ssl_compression=self.ssl_compression, cacert=self.cacert, session=session)

added_lines: import keystoneauth1.identity.generic as ks_auth_plugin import keystoneauth1.session as ks_session # Keystone will handle the tenant/project discrepancy for us. project_id = os_options.get('project_id', os_options.get('tenant_id')) project_name = os_options.get('project_name', os_options.get('tenant_name')) if insecure: verify = False else: if kwargs.get('cacert'): verify = kwargs.get('cacert') else: verify = True if os_options.get('auth_token'): auth = ks_auth_plugin.Token( auth_url=auth_url, token=os_options.get('auth_token'), project_id=project_id, project_name=project_name, project_domain_name=project_domain_name) else: auth = ks_auth_plugin.Password( auth_url=auth_url, project_id=project_id, project_name=project_name, project_domain_name=project_domain_name) session = ks_session.Session(auth=auth) try: endpoint = session.get_endpoint( region_name=os_options.get('region_name')) except exceptions.Unauthorized: msg = ('Unauthorized. Check username, password and tenant name/id ' 'and user/tenant domain name/id.') raise ClientException(msg) except exceptions.AuthorizationFailure as err: raise ClientException('Authorization Failure. %s' % err) return endpoint, session token = None elif auth_version in AUTH_VERSIONS_V1: session = None os_options['project_name'], user = user.split(':') os_options['project_name'] = kwargs['tenant_name'] token = None storage_url, session = get_auth_keystone(auth_url, user, key, os_options, cacert=cacert, insecure=insecure, cert=cert, cert_key=cert_key, timeout=timeout, auth_version=auth_version) self.url, self.token, self.session = get_auth( self.authurl, self.user, self.key, session=self.session, snet=self.snet, auth_version=self.auth_version, os_options=self.os_options, cacert=self.cacert, insecure=self.insecure, cert=self.cert, cert_key=self.cert_key, timeout=self.timeout) return self.url, self.token, self.session if not self.url or not (self.token or self.session): self.url, self.token, self.session = self.get_auth() # TODO: We need to pass the session here. url, _, _ = self.get_auth()

Check username, password and tenant name/id.' if auth_version in AUTH_VERSIONS_V3: msg = ('Unauthorized. commit_message:
Add keystone auth_url for creating the workflow client

mistralclient is moving away from using the kestoneclient code and going
forward to using just keystoneauth. This, however means that it's no
longer assuming the auth_url. So we need to pass it.

Change-Id: Ia046fbd008a8118b28d135239370c49873248849

commit_message:
Use persistent fernet-keys repo for keystone container

This creates /etc/keystone/fernet-keys in the overcloud host (or at
least it ensures it exists), and bind-mounts that to bot the container
running puppet and the keystone container itself. This allows us to do
key rotations easily and make those persistent.

Change-Id: I1e68e93e93fe8d53f7fa741ac24d64aed4422db0

commit_message:
Fix regexp for detecting long options

This commit fixes regexp in order to detect mandatory long arguments
with hyphen like '--foo-bar <foo-bar>'.

Note that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496189/ fixes the bug
paritally but it does not cover all cases.

Closes-Bug: #1706311
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I52b9fdecbf1abea1f819b0061fd80b7ca6e0906d

commit_message:
Add opendaylight role to tests a-r-r

In order to pass the lint test, all meta-dep
roles for the roles we execute in the test must
be present. As the os_neutron role recently got
the opendaylight role added as a meta-dep it is
now required here too.

Change-Id: I44dec03565e5be74cf3a03961e47180e50cf88a8

commit_message:
Set explicit default to enabled driver interfaces

this will allow any other devstack plugin that depends on ironic to
easier extend the list for a particular enabled interface type

current explicit defaults are copied from current ironic.conf.sample

Change-Id: I1e22a8dc4bb57e1b1e1002baab38ba2f3ba8f230
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/77/492877/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES:-"ipmi"} # list of all available driver interfaces types IRONIC_EXISTING_INTERFACES="boot power management deploy console inspect raid storage network vendor" IRONIC_ENABLED_BOOT_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_BOOT_INTERFACES:-"pxe"} IRONIC_ENABLED_DEPLOY_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_DEPLOY_INTERFACES:-"iscsi,direct"} IRONIC_ENABLED_MANAGEMENT_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_MANAGEMENT_INTERFACES:-"ipmitool"} IRONIC_ENABLED_POWER_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_POWER_INTERFACES:-"ipmitool"} IRONIC_ENABLED_CONSOLE_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_CONSOLE_INTERFACES:-"no-console"} IRONIC_ENABLED_INSPECT_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_INSPECT_INTERFACES:-"no-inspect"} IRONIC_ENABLED_RAID_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_RAID_INTERFACES:-"agent,no-raid"} IRONIC_ENABLED_VENDOR_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_VENDOR_INTERFACES:-"ipmitool,no-vendor"} IRONIC_ENABLED_STORAGE_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_STORAGE_INTERFACES:-"cinder,noop"} IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES:-"flat,noop"} # configure enabled interfaces local iface local iface_var for iface in "${IRONIC_EXISTING_INTERFACES}"; do iface_var="IRONIC_ENABLED_$(echo $iface | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]')_INTERFACES" iniset $IRONIC_CONF_FILE DEFAULT enabled_${iface}_interfaces ${!iface_var} done
deleted_lines: IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES:-ipmi} IRONIC_ENABLED_BOOT_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_BOOT_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_DEPLOY_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_DEPLOY_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_MANAGEMENT_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_MANAGEMENT_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_POWER_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_POWER_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_CONSOLE_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_CONSOLE_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_INSPECT_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_INSPECT_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_RAID_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_RAID_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_VENDOR_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_VENDOR_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_STORAGE_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_STORAGE_INTERFACES:-} IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES=${IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES:-}function configure_enabled_interfaces { local interface_name=$1 local interface_implementations=$2 if [[ -n $interface_implementations ]]; then iniset $IRONIC_CONF_FILE DEFAULT enabled_${interface_name}_interfaces $interface_implementations fi } configure_enabled_interfaces "boot" $IRONIC_ENABLED_BOOT_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "deploy" $IRONIC_ENABLED_DEPLOY_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "management" $IRONIC_ENABLED_MANAGEMENT_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "power" $IRONIC_ENABLED_POWER_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "console" $IRONIC_ENABLED_CONSOLE_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "inspect" $IRONIC_ENABLED_INSPECT_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "raid" $IRONIC_ENABLED_RAID_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "vendor" $IRONIC_ENABLED_VENDOR_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "storage" $IRONIC_ENABLED_STORAGE_INTERFACES configure_enabled_interfaces "network" $IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES

So create, in the same directory, a ``heat.conf`` file with below content: :: [trustee] auth_uri = {{ keystone_internal_uri }} auth_url = {{ keystone_internal_url }} [ec2authtoken] auth_uri = {{ keystone_internal_uri }} [clients_keystone] auth_uri = {{ keystone_internal_uri }} The Ceilometer section inside the configuration file also has to be updated to contact RegionOne's Keystone. So create, in the same directory, a ``ceilometer.conf`` file with below content: :: [service_credentials] auth_url = {{ keystone_internal_url }}

commit_message:
Trigger TripleO scenario001 and 004 on Mistral workflow changes

From Pike it will be possible to deploy Ceph via ceph-ansible in
TripleO. This is implemented triggering a Mistral workflow which
executes ansible on the undercloud.

This change executes tripleo scenario001 and scenario004 on
updates for the workflow.

Change-Id: Ia5771c85cad6431082daf32110cca15568a64161

commit_message:
Revert "Add ALLOCATING state to routers"

This reverts commit 9c3c19f07ce52e139d431aec54341c38a183f0b7.

Following the merge of Ie98d5e3760cdb17450aea546f4b61f5ba14baf1c, the
creation of new router uses RouterL3AgentBinding and its' new
binding_index attribute to ensure correctness of the resources. As such,
the ALLOCATING state (which was used to do just that) is no longer
needed and can be removed.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_db.py
	neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py
	neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py

Closes-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: Ib04e08df13ef4e6b94bd588854a5795163e2a617
(cherry picked from commit 3e4c0ae223de776732f70626b387fba4de2e9c3f)

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting,
which is replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx
releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I32f078169668be08737e47cd15edbdfba42904dc

commit_message:
Adjust the action state judgment logic

Only when True is returned, the action state is set to SUCCEEDED
some actions(such as migrate) will return None if exception raised

Change-Id: I52e7a1ffb68f54594f2b00d9843e8e0a4c985667

commit_message:
workload balance base on cpu or ram util

By the input parameter "metrics", it makes decision to migrate a VM
base on cpu or memory utilization.

Change-Id: I35cce3495c8dacad64ea6c6ee71082a85e9e0a83

Fix gnocchi repository URL in local.conf.controller

This patch set updates gnocchi repository URL in local.conf.controller
bacause it moved from under openstack to their own repository.

commit_message:
Separate greenfield and upgrade tests

In order to independently test a greenfield deploy
and an upgrade, with the upgrade's initial deploy
using the previous stable branch role, we seperate
the two tests.

This makes it a more accurate test without having
to do funky workarounds in the role required to
cater for two versions of galera.

Depends-On: Ic881bf3acf6fb6daf71611c26322f02fb8b0b9be
Depends-On: I5c88b2019c01b44193a5d0df9299ecce6de52f01
Depends-On: I8b09c2520c84bb43353b4c56bac157259f71b041
Needed-By: I2aca4721e4e023d315f3fcdae0f931dc960ef2be
Change-Id: I0c74e511cec01ed51101b873784c4a90a7302da6

commit_message:
Missing ExecStart in docker.service

docker.service requires extra ExecStart to clear "settings"
 - Added bug id for backport

Closes-Bug: #1712020
Change-Id: Ica9b8b5f7f57e1c8c87adc62df766c101bb03d2b
(cherry picked from commit 88684547e7ae1ab2beb7d7a328cd315c7127bd97)
